Definition: The tendency to view all experiences as fitting into one of two categories (e.g., positive or negative; good or bad) without the ability to place oneself, others, and experiences along a continuum.
Tips to Overcome: Things in life are rarely black and white. Focus on what’s positive or neutral about the situation.

Definition: The process of formulating rules or conclusions on the basis of limited experience and applying these rules across broad and unrelated situations.
Example: “It doesn’t matter what my choices are, they always fall flat”
Tips to Overcome: Recall times when things went well for you. Imagine what it would be like for things to go well next time.
Consider all diferent aspects of a person.

Definition: The process of foretelling or predicting the negative outcome of a future event or events and believing this prediction is absolutely true for oneself.
Tips to Overcome: Be curious about what’s going to happen next. Focus on what you can control and let go of what you can’t.

Definition: One’s arbitrary conclusion that someone is reacting negatively, or thinking negatively toward him/her, without specific evidence to support that conclusion.
Tips to Overcome: Try to imagine other, less negative possibilities. Try to ask the person what they’re thinking, rather than just assuming.

Definition: The predominant use of an emotional state to form conclusions about oneself, others, or situations.
Example: “I feel terrified about going on airplanes. It must be very dangerous to fly”
Tips to Overcome: Consider all the information you have.

Definition: A pattern of internal expectations or demands on oneself, without examination of the reasonableness of these expectations in the context of one’s life, abilities, and other resources.
Example: “I shouldn’t have made so many mistakes”

Definition: The process of assuming personal causality for situations, events, and reactions of others when there is no evidence supporting that conclusion.
Example: “That comment wasn’t just random, it must have been directed toward me”
Tips to Overcome: Think about where your unrealistic expectations came from. Let your mistakes be an opportunity to learn and grow.

Definition: The process of rejecting or discounting positive experiences, traits, or attributes.
Example: “This success experience was only a fluke”
Tips to Overcome: Think about all the other things that could be afecting someone’s behavior. Go out of your way to notice the positive side.

Definition: The process of evaluating, whereby one believes the worst possible outcome will or did occur.
Example: “I better not try because I might fail, and that would be awful”
Tips to Overcome: Keep in mind that worst-case scenarios are very unlikely. Try to remind yourself of all the more likely, less severe things that could happen.

Definition: The tendency to compare oneself whereby the outcome typically results in the conclusion that one is inferior or worse off than others.
Example: “I wish I were as comfortable with women as my brother is”
Tips to Overcome: Remember that what you see on social media and in public is everyone showing of their best.

Definition: Giving away your own power to other people.
Example: "It’s not my fault I yelled. You made me angry!”
Tips to Overcome: Take responsibility for whatever you can—no more, no less.

Definition: Getting “stuck” on a distressing thought, emotion, or belief.
Tips to Overcome: Feeling negative emotions is a normal part of life. Think about what we can control, and what positive things we can be grateful for.
